trans-unit.source: Extends design-time behavior for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content"></xref> Web server control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> object for this designer.

<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner> objects add <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> elements to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets a value indicating whether the control can be resized on the visual designer surface.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control can be resized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the markup that is used to represent the control at design time from the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> object.
The markup generated by GetDesignTimeHtml includes region identifiers.
GetDesignTimeHtml should add <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> elements to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> specified by the `regions` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> associated with the design-time markup generated by GetDesignTimeHtml.
The markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
Gets the content of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> object.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> elements are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> and the design-time markup contains region identifiers, the GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method is used to return the content for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection>
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> from which to get the content.
The persistence string for the content of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref>.
Gets the inner markup of the control.
A region is not a property of the control, so for persistent content, this method must return the inner HTML markup of the control.
The inner markup of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of properties that it exposes through a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> object.
This method provides a way to change or remove items within the dictionary of properties that are exposed through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties.
The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.
In this overridden method, the designer clears all properties except <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.ContentPlaceHolderID%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ID%2A>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> objects that represent the properties of the class of the component.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are property names.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of events that it exposes through a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor"></xref> object.
This method provides a way to add items to the dictionary of events that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
The keys in the dictionary of events are the names of the events.
The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor>.
In this overridden method, the designer clears all events for this control.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor"></xref> objects that represent the events of the class of the component.
The keys in the dictionary of events are event names.
Sets the content of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> object.
Developers will typically persist the content to the control or property that represents the region.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> elements are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> and the design-time markup contains region identifiers, the SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method is used to set the content for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> in which to set the content.
The persistence string for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> content.
